77bccefc-c611-4da8-afd9-88dd98c69e42.name: Champion - Enlighten Operational Excellence Accredited

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has completed planning simulations using load balancing resource requirements. Conducted role play's of motivational morning meetings. Proactive management, demonstrating understanding of plan verse actual, and the decisions that were made to deliver a positive result for their team. The earner has demonstrated their ability to ensure data integrity and can analyze results. The earner has investigated and identified data issues through simulations and accurately rectified issues.

The earner has completed the following online modules Activities, Beyond the Program, Employee Effectiveness Matrix, Enlighten and Active Management, Forecasting and Long Term Planning, Individual Performance Feedback, Management Equilibrium, Planning, Program Overview, Terminology, The Change Model, The Leadership Paradigm, Throughput, Value Added Assessments, Waste, Waste Revisited and Data Analysis.

The earner has completed the Practical Assessment including, Daily Turbo meeting, Forecasting, define 'waste', discuss management equilibrium examples and navigate team approval. They demonstrated their understanding of Enlighten Operational Excellence, can conduct/contribute to successful week in review meeting, produce an effective plan, conduct/contribute to a successful planning meeting, dissect enlighten weekly plan and utilize the skills matrix for training plans.

The earners management disciplines and behaviors in practice have been assessed by the internal center of excellence. The earner exhibits the following management behaviors on a day to day basis - approvals of work loads/ leave, conducts daily meetings, daily and weekly planning for the team, intraday/action, reviewing performance metrics, week in review, developing action plans, reviewing and removing waste and forecasting.

28015b2e-b94b-4897-b2f8-98f2335dfc5f.description: The earner has demonstrated that they can apply the Lean Six Sigma DMAIC methodology to quantify, scope and solve business problems so that business processes are improved to meet internal/external customer requirements. The earner understands the difference between Lean and Six Sigma and is competent in knowing when or when not to use the tools. The earner can apply data collection techniques and perform data analysis to statistically prove/disprove root-causes impact business problems.
28015b2e-b94b-4897-b2f8-98f2335dfc5f.name: Lean Six Sigma - Green Belt

badge_template_activities.title: • The earner has attended and actively participated in 100% of the interactive, training sessions that transfer knowledge on the history of Continuous Improvement, the distinction between various improvement methodologies, an introduction to Lean and Six Sigma along with detailed training on Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve and Control Phases of the Lean Six Sigma methodology.

• The earner has successfully, completed 100% of the Knowledge Assessment Tests for the Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve and Control Phases of the Lean Six Sigma methodology to self-assess their knowledge of technical tools and the context in which to use them. Furthermore, the earner has self-assessed their understanding of the key principles / philosophies of Lean and Six Sigma.

• The earner has scored higher than 80% on the Final Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Exam. This demonstrates that the earner is competent in the technical tools and when to apply them for each phase. The earner understands the purpose and outcome for each DMAIC Phase. The earner has a clear understanding of the key principles / philosophies of Lean and Six Sigma.

• The earner has successfully completed a Lean Six Sigma Green Belt project and demonstrated they can practically apply the Lean Six Sigma methodology in a real world environment to deliver tangible benefits. Successful project completion requires sign-off from the Project Sponsor that the earner has delivered and met the project objectives. Successful project completion also requires sign-off from a Lean Six Sigma Coach that the earner has competently applied the DMAIC methodology.

The earner has demonstrated competence in applying statistical tools to: establish process capability, ensure measurement systems are reliable, prove a statistical relation between the project problem (Y) and root-causes (X’s), design experiments (where applicable) and prove that the improvement in performance (Y) is statistically significant.

These courses include theory and practical assessments. The assessment component must be passed before moving to the next course in the learning path.

The earner can now describe what they should be doing as a manager compared to what you are currently doing and adjust accordingly. The earner can define how to manage in a proactive way rather than reactionary and confidently tailor their leadership style to the different reactions to change in your team.

The earner understands the management cycle of forecast, plan, action and report. The earner understands how the forecast and long-term plans work.
